interventions.practice: Conduct a power analysis.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Hewlett Foundation, Barr Foundation, Headwaters Foundation, Swift Foundation, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, Sol Collective, Threewalls

interventions.practice: Engage in somatic and embodied leadership training that addresses social position, rank, trauma, and race.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Weavers Project

interventions.practice: Get data about inequities in the allocation of funding in your region along racial and cultural lines. Measure your organization’s prior investment in BIPOC staff and grantees: culture-bearers and culturally-grounded organizations. Set internal and external benchmarks and practices for repair.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Borealis Philanthropy, Barr Foundation, Echoing Green, Threewalls

interventions.practice: Do diversity, equity, and inclusion training that is led by artists and culture-bearers.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Ford Foundation

interventions.practice: Take time during the workday to educate your group (public sector workers, investment and program staff, and board members) about the Solidarity Economy and the co-ops, credit unions, land trusts, and other entities in your region.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Center for Cultural Innovation, Barr Foundation

interventions.practice: Learn about distributed leadership and worker self-managed nonprofits.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Highlander Center, Sol Collective, New Economy Coalition

interventions.practice: Join a peer network and/or giving circle to support ongoing transformation.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Weavers Project, Caribbean Cultural Center African Diaspora Institute, Headwaters Foundation Giving Project

interventions.practice: Conduct listening sessions with grantees, stakeholders, community members, and the people most impacted by grantmaking decisions.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Surdna Foundation, Hewlett Foundation, Leeway Foundation, Kenneth Rainin Foundation, CultureBank

interventions.practice: Engage artists and staff in transformative justice and conflict transformation work.
interventions.exampleColleagues: McKnight Foundation

interventions.practice: Practice distributed leadership and/or become a worker self-managed nonprofit.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Highlander Center, Sol Collective, New Economy Coalition, Kenneth Rainin Foundation

interventions.practice: Movement leaders and community members make decisions as non-board members or board members.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Leeway Foundation

interventions.practice: Enable arts community-led participatory grantmaking for public arts monies.
interventions.exampleColleagues: SF Arts Commission

interventions.practice:
Transition from

a White-led family foundation to a foundation led by a multiracial community board.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Leeway Foundation

interventions.practice: Create a giving circle or donor collaboration that centers culture and Solidarity Economy work.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Arts Collaboratory

interventions.practice: Foundations (partner with a nonprofit to) provide fiscal sponsorship for investment cooperatives and mutual aid groups.
interventions.exampleColleagues:
NDN Collective, [Center for Economic Democracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.economicdemocracy.us/partners&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859714000&usg=AOvVaw32bdpuj4y3bh93VA5tM2tP),

[Social Impact Commons](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.socialimpactcommons.org/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859714000&usg=AOvVaw12DlJqP85faGWm3yPAvjg1), Springboard for the Arts
interventions.legal: Law Center [Mutual Aid Legal Toolkit](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.theselc.org/mutual_aid_toolkit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859715000&usg=AOvVaw382hEBJOA6i9q_AYbC3goB), [GIA Toolbox for Supporting Individual Artists](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.giarts.org/article/supporting-individual-artists&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859715000&usg=AOvVaw3zsduurPC_93ns8IW4I__q)

interventions.practice: Offer technical assistance and support from your legal counsel to help co-ops get incorporated.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Center for Cultural Innovation

interventions.practice: Fund communities to own their own property.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Center for Cultural Innovation in partnership with the Barr Foundation and Hewlett Foundation, East Bay Community Foundation

interventions.practice: Use your assets to secure loans for BIPOC arts and culture groups. Collateralize nonprofit property and assets to help BIPOC arts and culture centers access loans at much more favorable terms than if they had applied alone.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Agnes Gund

interventions.practice: Be early investors and technical assistance providers for community-owned businesses.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Center for Cultural Innovation, Barr Foundation, Hewlett Foundation

interventions.practice: Be early investors in cooperative financial institutions.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Center for Cultural Innovation, Barr Foundation, Hewlett Foundation, Nexus Northstar Black Cooperative Fellowship

interventions.practice: Support culturally anchoring grantees to have long-term affordable rental, to pay or buy out the mortgages, or act as guarantors to renegotiate these debts.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [Kenneth Rainin Foundation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://krfoundation.org/artsrealestate/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859726000&usg=AOvVaw2epjRwPXbw8z2xOE2HiWZV), Internet Archive, ArtBuilt

interventions.practice: Support intergenerational land stewardship and reparations work.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Resora / New Communities, NDN Collective, Center for Heirs' Property Preservation, Ohketeau Center

interventions.practice: Support culturally-grounded and community-led giving circles, peer-lending, and funder collaboratives.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [Asian Women Giving Circle](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://asianwomengivingcircle.org/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859730000&usg=AOvVaw3Or4pc7AT3dsgWMiQhYw_H), [Buen Vivir Fund](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thousandcurrents.org/buen-vivir-fund/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859730000&usg=AOvVaw1ImxM1DyJXdFnDA5X_SYG2), [Lunar Project](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.grapevine.org/fund/yosm3/The-Lunar-Project-Asian-Americans-in-Solidarity-with-the-Movemen%26sa%3DD%26ust%3D1612129889842000%26usg%3DAOvVaw0jt8YrXH8D7yz6BijN3YJP&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859730000&usg=AOvVaw1dajiNKPcAOl1ZykJCkFkR), Massachusetts Solidarity Economy Initiative from the Center for Economic Democracy, Headwaters Foundation

interventions.practice: Support peer-mentorship networks of grantees and culturally-grounded organizations who are working for the Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: DOEN Foundation, Surdna Foundation

interventions.practice: Support community currencies, local currencies, and time banks.
interventions.exampleColleagues:
City employees and residents paid in local currency: Yamato, Japan; Calgary, Canada, Maricá, Brazil.

Time Banks: Boston Ujima Project

interventions.practice: Support Solidarity Economy education for culture-bearers and artists to create initiatives and to support existing initiatives.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Weavers Project, Boston Ujima Project, [Springboard for the Arts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://springboardforthearts.org/jobs-opportunities/20-20-fellowship/%26sa%3DD%26source%3Deditors%26ust%3D1612468602465000%26usg%3DAOvVaw3MfIP4KzxPs4VORL9GrTfz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859736000&usg=AOvVaw1KlMAoiq3_xwa5LAWOO0Tl), [Alternate Roots](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://alternateroots.org/partners-in-action/%26sa%3DD%26source%3Deditors%26ust%3D1612468602465000%26usg%3DAOvVaw144W4bo3eoS_7-4izmp8dJ&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859737000&usg=AOvVaw36fKHDSYgbEiKbxZeZv8LW)

interventions.practice: Be a guarantor for any kind of debt.
Support land bank initiatives.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [East Bay Permanent Real Estate Cooperative](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ebprec.org/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859740000&usg=AOvVaw0mg03v74sbjBrbGc38y3KX)

interventions.practice: Provide patient or low-interest loans that allow intermediaries, including CDFIs, to provide flexible terms to small businesses such as royalty financing and convertible notes.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [Surdna](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://surdna.org/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859743000&usg=AOvVaw2rSXN5gnfTZy3f6WEZDfCo)

interventions.practice: Move deposits and fixed income portions of the investment portfolio to community development financial institutions such as credit unions.
interventions.exampleColleagues:
FB Heron Foundation, Swift Foundation, Schumacher Center for a New Economics,

[Mary Reynolds Babcock Foundation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nonprofitquarterly.org/justice-in-the-time-of-coronavirus-one-foundations-response-to-the-crisis/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859745000&usg=AOvVaw3hwnJ0cbezCisZZ-PkuAEZ), Springboard for the Arts

interventions.practice: Share your investment portfolio publicly or in peer group contexts to invite opportunities for accountability and collaboration.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Swift Foundation, Kristin Hull

interventions.practice: Create donor-advised funds and partner with fund managers to establish program-specific funds to directly source, evaluate and underwrite investments.
interventions.exampleColleagues: McKnight Foundation, Swift Foundation, Local Initiatives Support Corporation, California Public Employees Retirement System,

interventions.practice: Revise investment policies and mission/vision/bylaws to include support for the Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Morgan Simon, Mellon Foundation, Springboard for Arts, [Crosshatch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.crosshatch.org/what-we-do&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859750000&usg=AOvVaw3ojDSF0Ju1HJaKvrUBsLEu)

interventions.practice: Add financial and investment advisors who have knowledge and experience investing in the Solidarity Economy and culture.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Emerson Collective, Start Small, Akonadi Foundation, Blue Haven Initiative, Nia Impact Capital

interventions.practice: Make portfolio investments that are mission-aligned and operating in concert with grantmaking.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Kataly Foundation, Heron Foundation, McKnight Foundation, Surdna Foundation, Swift Foundation, Barr Foundation, Mellon Foundation, Doris Duke Foundation
interventions.legal: Law Center [training about Foundation investments](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DLmraBmPBWvw%26feature%3Dyoutu.be&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859754000&usg=AOvVaw3EV6iOqh8TEbpSDQqptW4k) and the [Prudent Investor Rule](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3Dxdfulq0Grwk%26feature%3Dyoutu.be&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859754000&usg=AOvVaw3_jT2VP0go7VR8tw_ddk3-)

interventions.practice: Make bold investments in the Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues:
Swift Foundation, Barr Foundation,

CultureBank, [Buen Vivir Fund](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thousandcurrents.org/buen-vivir-fund/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859756000&usg=AOvVaw2_jhuHnJGWnPuilup9_23d), MacKenzie Scott

interventions.practice: Join a peer group to continue learning about transforming finance.
interventions.exampleColleagues:
YOXI, Surdna Foundation,

Yerba Buena Center for the Arts

interventions.practice: Increase your “spend rate” to 10% or more or spend down the endowment.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Fund for Democratic Communities, Merck Foundation, Patriotic Millionaires

interventions.practice: Make concessionary or below market investments that support the Solidarity Economy.
Support the development of relationships and collaborations between strong regional networks with a focus on culture and the Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [Center for Economic Democracy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.economicdemocracy.us/partners&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859764000&usg=AOvVaw3cyroQywIaG81PD605k-wA), Surdna Foundation, NDN Collective

interventions.practice: Support the development of relationships and collaborations internationally with a focus on culture and the Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: DOEN / ArtsCollaboratory, Kadist / AField, Lambent Foundation

interventions.practice: Support existing business development and technical assistance providers in arts and culture to work with existing Solidarity Economy groups, and vice versa.
interventions.exampleColleagues: The Center for Cultural Innovation, Barr Foundation, Hewlett Foundation, Invest4All, [Detroit Entrepreneurs of Color](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://missioninvestors.org/news/evolution-detroit-s-entrepreneurs-color-fund&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859768000&usg=AOvVaw3hQGb_7Crc37OLRbJKW6AF), Libra Foundation, EBCF, San Francisco Foundation

interventions.practice: Support cross-sector collaborations and supply-chains and technical assistance for culture and Solidarity Economy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: No one is doing this yet.

interventions.practice: Create culture and economic justice portfolios; reward collaboration across culture and economic justice portfolios.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Surdna, [McKnight](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://www.mcknight.org/programs/vibrant-and-equitable-communities/%26sa%3DD%26source%3Deditors%26ust%3D1612613844457000%26usg%3DAOvVaw2YnPDZ_fPzlJfjktPbIDHf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859771000&usg=AOvVaw2d2o4avr0-du3diy76WnwM)

interventions.practice: Fund communications strategy and media at Solidarity Economy institutions and networks.
interventions.exampleColleagues: No one is doing this yet.

interventions.practice: Fund permanent research centers for Solidarity Economy and culture
interventions.exampleColleagues: No one is doing this yet.

interventions.practice: Convene Solidarity Economy lawyers and financial innovators and center culture-bearers, artists, and culturally-grounded organizations.
interventions.exampleColleagues: No one is doing this yet.

interventions.practice: Convene the next generation of public sector workers with culturally-grounded organizations, artists, and culture-bearers.
interventions.exampleColleagues: No one is doing this yet. Consider [DAWI’s Seed Fellowship](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://institute.coop/sites/default/files/SEED%2520Fellowship%2520v03.01.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859778000&usg=AOvVaw2IPbL3kruHwn8_E31Sbdks) as a model, shifting the focus to arts and culture.

interventions.practice:
Transform due diligence processes to include and account for three additional questions: Does it spread power? Does it spread wealth?

Does it root community wealth and power?
interventions.legal:
[SELC presentation on Legal and Strategic Frontiers of](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1QpmVEjy3lf_nx67XJDTP13Xbz3CcKQFlorzO50KIg9Q/edit%23slide%3Did.g7db1f80327_0_2022&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859781000&usg=AOvVaw3CPL6HMrtima8o85Ur0yro)

[Foundation Investments (begin at slide 65)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1QpmVEjy3lf_nx67XJDTP13Xbz3CcKQFlorzO50KIg9Q/edit%23slide%3Did.g7db1f80327_0_2022&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859782000&usg=AOvVaw2AiAOzBSLT-iZuKbJK_GLb)

interventions.practice: Invest with BIPOC financial partners—even at investment firms without a stated commitment to investing in BIPOC—evidence suggests venture capital firms led by BIPOC are also more likely to support investees or communities of color.
Work to reach outside of your network because evidence suggests people tend to build networks within their race or ethnicity.
Bank at Black-owned banks.
interventions.exampleColleagues: [Prudential Financial](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ssir.org/articles/entry/diversity_and_inclusion_turning_shared_value_into_shared_success&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859791000&usg=AOvVaw2_Ue5rThP4yRWURhLUou0q), [Winthrop Rockefeller Foundation](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ssir.org/articles/entry/aligning_purpose_and_investments_why_are_you_stuck%23&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859791000&usg=AOvVaw1HpM3JHqxR7EOUvHcC0-cH)

interventions.practice: Support the organizations that are already doing Solidarity Economy and co-op Policy Advocacy advocacy.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Borealis

interventions.practice: Advocate for guaranteed basic income.
interventions.exampleColleagues: San Francisco Foundation,Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, St. Paul Foundation,  Springboard for the Arts

interventions.practice: Support public procurement from Solidarity Economy entities; hire artists and culture-bearers as full-time employees.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Rachel Chanoff and THE OFFICE, [Springboard for the Arts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.google.com/url?q%3Dhttps://springboardforthearts.org/programs/artist-organizers/%26sa%3DD%26source%3Deditors%26ust%3D1612468602464000%26usg%3DAOvVaw2jrDioypartLe_thY2YRFo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1614440859800000&usg=AOvVaw3QXpLXXALb9yigCj1igyKK), San Francisco Creative Corps

interventions.practice: Support peer-to-peer Policy Advocacy exchange.
interventions.exampleColleagues: SF Arts Coalition

interventions.practice: Support artists, culture-bearers, and cooperative and solidarity entrepreneurship programs in public education and in the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.
interventions.exampleColleagues: Juxtaposition Arts, Appalshop

interventions.practice: Support the Cultural New Deal and People’s Works Progress Administration.
Advocate for increased minimum payout rates.
Center culture in community benefit agreements.
Expand the Community Reinvestment Act.
